content.title: Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Ninaivu Inter-caste Marriage Assistance Scheme-I
content.department: Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department
content.beneficiary: Newly married couples with one spouse from Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe and the other from a different Community
content.details: The 'Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Ninaivu Inter-caste Marriage Assistance Scheme' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme's objective is to abolish caste and community discrimination by encouraging inter-caste marriage by giving financial assistance to newly married couples of whom one spouse should be from a Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe and the other from a different Community.
benefits: 1 Sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam
eligibility: The bride should have passed the 10th standard (5th standard in case the applicant is from a Scheduled Tribe)
The age of the bride should be above 18 years at the time of marriage
One spouse should be from a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe and the other should be from a different Community
content.application_process: Online - via CSCs. The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme, visit the nearest Common Service Center (CSC) for Biometric Verification, fill in the application form, and request a receipt or acknowledgement.

faqs.question: Can you explain the process of disbursal of financial assistance in detail?
faqs.answer: ₹15,000 is disbursed through Electronic Clearing Service, and ₹10,000 is provided in the form of National Savings Certificate as part of the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the deadline for submitting the application under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted within two years from the date of marriage.

faqs.question: What documents are required for the application process under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Documents include Marriage Invitation/Marriage Registration Certificate, Community Certificates of the bride and bridegroom, and the Age Certificate of the bride.

faqs.question: What is the mode of application for the scheme, and where can applicants apply online?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online via the Common Service Center (CSC) by completing the Biometric Verification Process.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for brides participating in the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bride should have passed the 10th standard, and the age should be above 18 years at the time of marriage.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance disbursed under the scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹15,000 is disbursed through Electronic Clearing Service, and ₹10,000 is provided in the form of National Savings Certificate.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided to newly married couples under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Couples receive ₹25,000 along with a 1 Sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam.

faqs.question: Which department of the government launched this scheme, and in which state is it implemented?
faqs.answer: The Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department launched the scheme in Tamil Nadu.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the 'Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Ninaivu Inter-caste Marriage Assistance Scheme'?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to abolish caste and community discrimination by encouraging inter-caste marriage through financial assistance.

faqs.question: Can applicants submit physical copies of documents, or is the application process entirely online?
faqs.answer: The application process is primarily online through the Common Service Center (CSC), where applicants upload copies of necessary documents.

faqs.question: What role does the Common Service Center (CSC) play in the application process, and why is biometric verification necessary?
faqs.answer: CSC serves as the online application platform, and biometric verification ensures the authenticity of the applicants.

faqs.question: Are there any educational qualifications required for the bride to be eligible for the scheme, and how are these qualifications specified?
faqs.answer: The bride should have passed the 10th standard, and in the case of Scheduled Tribes, 5th standard qualification is accepted.
